  • Welcome to Contact book’s documentation!

Welcome to Contact book’s documentation!¶

REST API repository Contact¶

async src.repository.contact.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Connect to the database

  • user:User – Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contact.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user:User – Check if the user is allowed to delete the contact

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

async src.repository.contact.get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_all_contacts function returns a list of all contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

async src.repository.contact.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contact function is used to retrieve a contact from the database. It takes in an integer representing the id of the contact, and returns a Contact object. If no such contact exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Filter the contact by id

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user:User – Ensure that the user requesting the contact is the owner of it

Returns:

A single contact

async src.repository.contact.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user:User – Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contact.get_contacts_birthday(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts_birthday function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user:User – Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days

async src.repository.contact.get_contacts_select(name: str, last_name: str, email: str, limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts_select function is used to retrieve contacts from the database. It takes in a name, last_name, email, limit and offset as parameters. The function then uses these parameters to create a select statement that will be executed by the database session object passed into it. If any of the optional parameters are not provided they will be ignored when creating this select statement.

Parameters:

  • name – str: Filter the contacts by name

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – str: Filter the contacts by email

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the first row to return

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user:User – Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contact.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactUpdateSchema): A schema containing all fields that can be updated for a Contact object. This is used to validate and deserialize the request body into an object that can be passed into this function as an argument. See ContactUpdateSchema for more details on what fields are required/optional, etc…

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact we want to delete

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Get the data from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user:User – Identify the user who is making the request

Returns:

The contact object that was updated

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes an email address and a database connection, and marks the user with that email as confirmed. It does not return anything.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to be confirmed

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the incoming request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The newly created user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_user_by_email function takes an email address and returns the user object associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email of the user to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A single user

async src.repository.users.new_password(email: str, new_password: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The new_password function takes an email and a new password,

then updates the user’s password in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user who wants to change their password

  • new_password:str – Pass in the new password

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

The updated user object

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar URL for a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the user from the database

  • url – str | None: Specify that the url parameter is either a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A user object, which is the updated user

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Specify the user object that will be updated

  • token – str | None: Update the user’s refresh token

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

REST API routes Contact¶

async src.routes.contact.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

It takes a ContactSchema object as input, and returns the newly created contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body, and to convert it into a contact object

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user:User – Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

The created contact

async src.routes.contact.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be deleted, and returns a dictionary containing information about that contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact_id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user:User – Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

async src.routes.contact.get_all_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_all_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of the parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning results

  • ge – Specify the minimum value for a parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contact.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. If no such contact exists, it will return a 404 error.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

  • current_user:User – Get the user id of the current user

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contact.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned to 500

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of limit

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user:User – Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contact.get_contacts_birthday(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts_birthday function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays in the current month.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user:User – Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday today

async src.routes.contact.get_contacts_select(name: str = Query(None), last_name: str = Query(None), email: str = Query(None), limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts_select function is used to search for contacts by name, last_name or email.

The function returns a list of contacts that match the search criteria.

Parameters:

  • name – str: Search by name

  • description – Add a description to the parameter

  • last_name – str: Search by last name, the limit: int parameter is used to set a limit of 10 contacts per page and the offset: int parameter is used to set an offset of 0

  • description – Document the endpoint

  • email – str: Search by email

  • description – Provide a description of the endpoint in the openapi documentation

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • ge – Check if the value is greater or equal to the value specified

  • le – Limit the number of results that can be returned

  • offset – int: Set the offset of the query

  • ge – Validate that the value is greater than or equal to a given number

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

  • current_user:User – Validate that the user is logged in

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contact.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

It takes an id, body and db as parameters. The id is used to find the contact in the database, while body contains all of the information that will be updated for that contact. If no such contact exists then it returns a 404 error.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Validate the body of the request

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user:User – Get the user who is making the request

Returns:

A contact object

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_me function returns the current user’s information.

—

get:

description: Returns the current user’s information. responses: # The possible responses that can be returned by this function, and their status codes. This is a helpful way to document what your API will return when called with different parameters or in different states of operation. It also helps you think about how you want to handle errors and other exceptional cases!

Parameters:

current_user – User: Specify that the function expects a user object

Returns:

The current user

async src.routes.users.update_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The update_avatar function is used to update the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

  • user – User: Get the user from the database

Returns:

The user object with the updated avatar

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm the user’s email address.

It takes a token as an argument and returns a message if the email has been confirmed or not.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the message key and a string value

async src.routes.auth.forget_password(fpr: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The forget_password function is used to send an email to the user with a link to reset their password. The function takes in the RequestEmail schema, which contains the email of the user who wants to reset their password. It then checks if that email exists in our database, and if it does not exist, we return a 500 error code with an appropriate message. If it does exist however, we call our background task function send_email_reset_password and pass in the users’ username and base url as parameters.

Parameters:

  • fpr – RequestEmail: Get the email address from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

A jsonresponse object

async src.routes.auth.get_user_by_reset_token(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_user_by_reset_token function is used to get a user by their reset token.

This function will return the user’s email address if they have a valid reset token.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the token

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes in the email and password of the user, verifies that they are correct, and then returns an access token for future requests.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the access token, refresh token and the type of token

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the access token from the header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A new access token and a new refresh token

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will confirm their account.

The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address. It then checks if the user exists and if they have already confirmed their account. If they haven’t, it sends them an email with a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Pass the email address to the function

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database session from the dependency

Returns:

A message to the user, which will be displayed on the frontend

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(token: str, new_password: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The reset_password function takes a token and new password as input,

then checks if the user exists in the database. If they do exist, it will update their password to the new one provided.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • new_password – str: Get the new password from the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

A message if the user’s email is not confirmed

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserSchema object as input, and returns the newly created user. If an account with that email already exists, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • bt:BackgroundTasks – Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '974790aec4ac460bdc11645decad4dce7c139b7f2982b7428ec44e886ea588c6'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

The function takes in two parameters: data and expires_delta. Data is a dictionary that contains information about the user, such as their username and email address. Expires_delta is an optional parameter that specifies how long the access token will be valid for.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables

  • data – dict: Store the data that will be encoded in the access token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A jwt token that is encoded with the data provided and a secret key

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function creates a token that is used to verify the user’s email address. The token is created using the JWT library and contains information about when it was issued, when it expires, and what user id it belongs to.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that is to be encoded

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email, a timestamp of when it was created and an expiration date

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

The function takes in two parameters: data and expires_delta. Data is a dictionary containing the user’s id, username, email address, and password hash. Expires_delta is an optional parameter that sets how long before the refresh token expires.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s data to be encoded

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

The encoded refresh token

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

The function takes in a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if successful. If unsuccessful, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message ‘Invalid scope for token’ or ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that is sent to the server

Returns:

The email of the user who is trying to refresh their access token

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

get_current_active_user endpoint. It takes in a token and db session, decodes the JWT, checks if it’s an access token or refresh token, then returns the user object from cache or database.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The user object which is then used to check if the user has access to a certain route

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function first tries to decode the token using jwt.decode(). If successful, it will return the email address associated with that user’s account. If unsuccessful, it will raise an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email address

Returns:

The email address that is encoded in the jwt

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password and returns the hashed version of it. The hashing algorithm is defined in the config file, which is imported into this module.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is being hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function is used to verify a plain-text password against a hashed password. The function returns True if the passwords match, and False otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that was entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Store the hashed password from the database

Returns:

A boolean value

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their account.
The function takes in three parameters:

  • email: the user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for each account.

  • username: the name of the user that will be displayed on their profile page and in other places throughout Contacts Systems. This parameter is not required, but it helps personalize emails sent by Contacts Systems and makes them more friendly for users who are new to our service.

  • host: this parameter specifies where we want users to go when they click on links contained within emails sent

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object

async src.services.email.send_email_reset_password(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email_reset_password function sends an email to the user with a link to reset their password.
The function takes in three parameters:

  • email: the user’s email address, as a string.

  • username: the user’s username, as a string. This is used for personalization of the message body and subject line.

  • host: this is used for personalization of the message body and subject line.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the user

  • username – str: Pass the username of the user to be sent an email

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to be used in the email template

Returns:

A response object
